answerOptions.answerText: Embedding one struct type within another.
Creating a loop in the ownership of objects.
Converting an object into a primitive type.
Sharing an object with multiple addresses.

questionText: What happens to an object when it is wrapped within another object in Move?

answerOptions.answerText: It can be accessed directly via its ID on-chain.
It no longer exists independently and can only be accessed through the wrapping object.
It is deleted from the network.

questionText: Which method of wrapping allows an object to optionally contain another object that can be replaced later?
In the trusted swap example, what is the purpose of the `SwapRequest` struct?

answerOptions.answerText: To wrap the object to be swapped and record the original owner.
To enforce the scarcity of the object.
To generate a new object ID.
To delete the object after the swap.
